sense.name: move a lid/door as to block an opening
sense.examples: Please shut the gate. This window won't shut. It's jammed. I've got a surprise for you! Shut your eyes tightly and hold out your hand. Mary shut her book and put it down on the table. When you have done so, shut the top valve so no air can enter.

sense.name: stop the supply, flow, or passage
sense.examples: Did you remember to shut off the water and gas before you left the house? Oil supplies have been shut off. Shut off the light before you leave the room. Rotate either of them in a clock-wise direction to shut the flow of water. I have shut the stream down and bypassed it with pipe between the filter and stream.

sense.name: confine or lock someone or something away
sense.commentary: Includes: SHUT AWAY, SHUT IN, SHUT UP
sense.examples: He was ten years old when he was shut away in an asylum for stealing an apple. They took him away and shut him in a prison. He was so upset that he shut himself in his bedroom and refused to come out. Nero Caesar seized him and shut him up in prison.

sense.name: exclude, push away, isolate, or keep something out
sense.examples: She was shut off from her friends. When her husband died she seemed to shut herself off from her friends and family. She finds it impossible to shut out the memory of the accident. Don't forget to shut the cat out when you leave for work. The double glazing shuts out most of the traffic noise. Anna felt shut out of the conversation.

sense.name: (cause to) end or stop operating
sense.examples: Another factory shut because it was losing money. The owner decided to move and shut down the factory. This computer is stuck. It won't shut down.

sense.name: (cause to) stop speaking or bring about silence
sense.commentary: Includes: SHUT UP, SHUT ONE'S MOUTH
sense.examples: The children shut up when their father approached. Everyone just shut up!
